DOC.brief_title: Local Anesthetic Nebulization Instillation Pain Control After Laparoscopic Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: Studies evaluate intraperitoneal local anesthetic ( LA ) instillation pain relief laparoscopic cholecystectomy provide conflict result . One factor might contribute failure instillation technique may relate inadequate distribution local anesthetic throughout peritoneal surface . In contrast , nebulization provide uniform spread drug throughout peritoneal cavity thus may beneficial improve pain relief laparoscopic procedure . A recent study report bupivacaine nebulization significantly reduce pain laparoscopic cholecystectomy compare bupivacaine instillation gallbladder bed . However , investigator use custom-made nebulization system need separate gas source tube cumbersome may easily available . Recently , investigator report microvibration-based nebulization device ( Aeroneb Pro® system , Aerogen , Galway , Ireland ) could use ropivacaine delivery insufflation gas require create pneumorpeitoneum . The investigator hypothesize intraperitoneal ropivacaine nebulization would provide superior pain relief laparoscopic cholecystectomy intraperitoneal ropivacaine instillation . This randomized , double blind , control clinical trial design assess analgesic efficacy ropivacaine nebulization use Aeroneb Pro® device laparoscopic cholecystectomy compare intraperitoneal ropivacaine instillation .
